LanguageData.SY_LM.TooltipLightMapGradientHue:
Set colours for the gradient as hue in degrees, according to light level:
0+% = black 10+% = 50% from black to [1st] 20+% = [1st] (dark) 30+% = 50% from [1st] to [2nd] 40+% = 67% from [1st] to [2nd] =50% = [2nd] (lit, artificial) 50+% = [3rd] (plants grow) 60+% = 20% from [3rd] to white 70+% = 40% from [3rd] to white 80+% = 60% from [3rd] to white 90+% = 85% from [3rd] to white 100+% = white
LanguageData.SY_LM.TooltipLightMapRoofedAreasOnly: Only show brightness overlay for roofed areas
LanguageData.SY_LM.TooltipMovementSpeedMapGradientHue:
Set colours for the gradient as hue in degrees, according to movement speed:
no path = black 1-99% = [1st] to [2nd] 100% = white 100+% = [3rd] (probably unachievable)
LanguageData.SY_LM.TooltipBeautyMapGradientHue: Set colours for the gradient as hue in degrees, according to beauty
LanguageData.SY_LM.TooltipBeautyMapAverageBeauty:
WARNING This mode is VERY VERY SLOW, but calculates the average beauty per tile as used for the beauty need of pawns.
You will not be able to unpause the game while this overlay is active!
LanguageData.SY_LM.TooltipMapIconButtonVisible: Toggles whether the icon button for this map mode is shown ingame in the lower right
LanguageData.SY_LM.TooltipHue: - Colours: 0° = red 60° = yellow 120° = green 180° = cyan 240° = blue 300° = magenta Colours wrap around at 360° e.g. 360=0 or 540=180 This can be used to create backward gradients, for example red (360) to green (120) via blue (240) instead of red (0) to green (120) via yellow (60)
